script_en: Vegetables are healthy? That's a plant's trap. Plants that can't move protect themselves with chemical weapons that make you sick. Plants can't run away. So they produce toxins called 'secondary metabolites' to repel predators. These are lectins, oxalates, phytates, and alkaloids. Nightshade vegetables like tomatoes and eggplants contain solanine, a neurotoxin. Legumes contain lectins that clump red blood cells. All of these are plant self-defense mechanisms to avoid being eaten. Eating vegetables means falling into the 'poison trap' that plants have set. Throughout 2 million years of human evolution, we never made plants our 'staple food'. Meat and fat are our true diet.
